result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy Raul Rivas Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roy Raul Rivas Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Roy Raul Rivas Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for John Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery, but still needs an offer from the State. Defense may file possible motion and requests adjourned scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roy Raul Rivas Jr. appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Roy Raul Rivas Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #04CF1452. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Lanza. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roy Raul Rivas Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Roy Raul Rivas Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk in court for Attorney John Rejowsi for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for State v Lee hearing. Attorney OReilly has recently been appointed as counsel so there is no need for hearing at this time. Matter to be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Case adjourned to Br. PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy Raul Rivas Jr. not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is/is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy Raul Rivas Jr. not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for State of Wisconsin in court. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Roy Raul Rivas in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Roy Raul Rivas in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
